intro: Pilosella neriedowae, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features dense, soft, grayish-white hairs on its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive fuzzy appearance. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Pilosella neriedowae is relatively small, with flowers that bloom in early summer, adding a delicate touch to its high-altitude habitat.
